text: Yoshio Ikeda (池田芳夫) (born January 1, 1942, Osaka) is a Japanese jazz double- bassist. Ikeda received formal training in bass before studying jazz with Gary Peacock in the 1960s.Kazunori Sugiyama, "Yoshio Ikeda". The New Grove Dictionary of Jazz. 2nd edition, ed. Barry Kernfeld. He led his own small groups in the 1970s, and has worked with Terumasa Hino, Masabumi Kikuchi, Steve Lacy, Akira Miyazawa, Yuji Ohno, Allan Praskin, Masahiko Sato, Masahiko Togashi, Kiyoshi Sugimoto, Aki Takase, and Sadao Watanabe. ==References== Category:Japanese jazz double-bassists Category:Musicians from Tokyo Category:1942 births Category:Living people
title: Yoshio Ikeda
